title: Giorgio Napolitano
summary: Giorgio Napolitano (Italian: [ˈdʒordʒo napoliˈtaːno]; born 29 June 1925)[1] is an Italian politician who served as the 11th president of Italy from 2006 to 2015, and the only Italian president to be reelected to the presidency. Due to his dominant position in Italian politics, some critics have sometimes referred to him as Re Giorgio ("King George").[2] He is the longest serving president in the history of the modern Italian Republic, which has been in existence since 1946.
